description$PL: Luthier from Verona, creator of string instruments of great quality and beauty, whose art lives on through his works.

paragrafo$PL: Romano Biondani was an Italian luthier and musician. Born in Verona, after completing his academic studies at the “Dall’Abaco” Conservatory, he joined the orchestra of what was then the “Ente Lirico Arena di Verona.” This experience eventually led him to discover—and develop a deep passion for—the world of string instruments and their constructiooooon.

He began studying lutherie as a self-taught artisan, attending several luthiers’ workshops, including that of Mario Gadda in Mantua, where he refined his skills. Biondani’s career as a luthier spanned from 1989 to 2012 and took place not only in Verona, but also, for health reasons, in the nearby Lessinia region—particularly in the towns of Cerro Veronese and Bosco Chiesanuova.

He began studying lutherie as a self-taught artisan, attending several luthiers’ workshops, including that of Mario Gadda in Mantua, where he refined his skills. Biondani’s career as a luthier spanned from 1989 to 2012 and took place not only in Verona, but also, for health reasons, in the nearby Lessinia region—particularly in the towns of Cerro Veronese and Bosco Chiesanuova.

His work focused on the construction of violins and violas, using only the finest, carefully seasoned tonewoods. Thanks to this meticulous selection of materials, Biondani was able to craft instruments that stood out for their exceptional resonance, artisanal elegance, and sound quality.

His work focused on the construction of violins and violas, using only the finest, carefully seasoned tonewoods. Thanks to this meticulous selection of materials, Biondani was able to craft instruments that stood out for their exceptional resonance, artisanal elegance, and sound quality.

descrizione$L: Are you interested in one of the instruments or do you have questions about the collection?

descrizione$PL: Fill out the form to receive more details about this instrument.

paragrafo$PL: Gaetano Soliman, violist and conductor, has been a passionate advocate for the work of Romano Biondani. As both a family member and a direct witness to the luthier’s craftsmanship, he is committed to restoring and preserving the instruments created by Biondani.
His mission is not only to bring Biondani’s work back into the spotlight, but also to promote the appreciation of the exceptional quality and uniqueness of his instruments.

descrizione$L: Curious about the life and legacy of Romano Biondani?

descrizione$PL: Would you like to learn more about the story and instruments of Romano Biondani? Fill out the form and we will get back to you as soon as possible.

description$PL:
Last updated: 04/06/2025


1. Introduction

This Privacy Policy describes how the website www.romanobiondani.com (hereinafter referred to as the “Website” or the “Controller”) processes users’ personal data in accordance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (“GDPR”) and Italian legislation.


2. Data Controller

The Data Controller is:
Gaetano Soliman
Email: romanobiondani@gmail.com
For any questions or requests regarding the processing of personal data, you can contact us at the email address above.


3. Data Protection Officer (DPO)

No Data Protection Officer has been appointed, as we do not fall under the obligations set out in Article 37 of the GDPR.


4. Personal Data Collected

The Website collects exclusively:

  • Data voluntarily provided via Google Forms: name, surname, email, phone number, and any other data freely entered in the form.

  • Anonymous traffic data, collected in aggregated form and not traceable to users, through Cloudflare Web Analytics (without cookies or personal identifiers).

The Website does not use profiling cookies or invasive tracking tools.

5. Purposes and Legal Basis of Processing

PurposeData ProcessedLegal Basis
Managing requests via formData provided in the formExplicit consent
Website traffic analysis and performance (Cloudflare)Aggregated and anonymized dataLegitimate interest of the Controller

Providing data via the form is optional but necessary to receive a response. No identifiable data is collected for analytics purposes.


6. Method and Retention Period

Data is processed using IT tools, in a lawful and secure manner.

  • Data sent via Google Forms is retained for a maximum of 2 years, unless required for legal purposes.

  • Anonymous data collected by Cloudflare is not traceable to the user and is not stored on the Website.


7. Recipients and International Transfers

Data may be processed by:

  • Google LLC, via Google Forms – Data Processor. Data may be transferred to the USA in compliance with the Data Privacy Framework or Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs).

  • Cloudflare Inc., for anonymous traffic analysis – Data Processor. Data is processed in accordance with SCCs and the DPF.

The Controller ensures that all service providers comply with the GDPR.


8. Data Subject Rights

You have the right to:

  • Access your data

  • Rectify or erase data

  • Restrict processing

  • Object to processing

  • Data portability

  • Withdraw consent

To exercise these rights, please contact us at the address provided in section 2.


9. Right to Lodge a Complaint

You have the right to lodge a complaint with the Italian Data Protection Authority if you believe that your data is being processed in violation of the GDPR.


10. Profiling and Automated Decision-Making

The Website does not use profiling or automated decision-making processes that produce legal or similarly significant effects for users.


11. Cookies and Other Tools

The Website does not use profiling cookies.
For traffic analysis, we use Cloudflare Web Analytics, which does not set cookies or collect personal data.


12. Updates to the Privacy Policy

This Privacy Policy may be updated. We encourage you to review it periodically.


Last updated: 04/06/2025

Last updated: 04/06/2025


1. What Are Cookies?

Cookies are small text files that a website can store on your device (computer, smartphone, tablet) when you visit it.
They can be used to remember your preferences, improve navigation, or collect information about user behavior.


2. Cookies Used by This Website

The website www.romanobiondani.com is hosted on Cloudflare Pages and uses an essential and privacy-friendly configuration. Below are details on the possible cookies in use:


a) Technical Cookies (Strictly Necessary)

Cloudflare (Security and Performance Services)
Cloudflare may set strictly technical and necessary cookies in order to:

  • protect the site from malicious access (e.g., DDoS attacks)

  • properly manage network traffic

  • ensure service availability

Examples of potentially used cookies:
__cf_bm, cf_clearance, __cfruid, _cfuvid

These cookies do not collect personal data and are essential for the website's functionality. They do not require prior consent, but users are informed about their use.


b) Analytics Cookies – Cloudflare Web Analytics (No Cookies)

To anonymously and collectively monitor the usage of the site, we use Cloudflare Web Analytics, which:

  • does not set cookies

  • does not use fingerprinting

  • does not identify users

Therefore, no consent is required for this type of analytics.


c) Google Forms

The website integrates Google Forms to collect data through forms voluntarily filled out by users.

Google does not install tracking cookies through the embedded form.
No profiling activity is carried out through Google Forms on our website.

For more details, please refer to our @L{Privacy}


3. Cookie Management

Since the site does not use unnecessary or profiling cookies, no consent banner or Consent Management Platform (CMP) is required.

If you wish, you can still:

  • change your browser settings to block or delete all cookies

  • consult your browser's documentation for more information

Disabling technical cookies may affect the proper functioning of the website.


4. Updates to the Cookie Policy

This Cookies Policy may be updated to reflect technical or regulatory changes. The date of the last update is shown at the top of this page.


5. Link to the Privacy Policy

For detailed information on how your personal data is processed, your rights, and how to exercise them, please refer to our @L{Privacy}.
